IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO DEVELOP AN AFFORDABLE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY FOR LOW INCOME SENIOR CITIZENS IN BALTIMORE CITY. STADIUM PLACE IS A MODEL URBAN RETIREMENT COMMUNITY FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME SENIORS THAT WILL OFFER A CONTINUUM OF CARE AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO HELP OLDER ADULTS LIVE ACTIVE LIVES AND AGE IN COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO DEVELOP AN AFFORDABLE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY FOR LOW INCOME SENIOR CITIZENS IN BALTIMORE CITY WITH A FULL CONTINUUM OF CARE TO ALLOW AGING IN COMMUNITY. THE STADIUM PLACE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY WILL MAXIMIZE THE PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND SPIRITUAL POTENTIAL OF INDIVIDUALS THROUGH A HOLOSITIC CONTINUUM OF SUPPORT SERVICES AND SENIOR HOUSING.
IRS990.Desc: STADIUM PLACE, INC. HAS FACILITATED THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE STADIUM PLACE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY WHICH CURRENTLY IS HOME TO OVER 400 LOW INCOME SENIOR CITIZENS RESIDING IN 4 INDEPENDANT LIVING APARTMENT BUIDLINGS AND THE GREEN HOUSE (R) LONG TERM CARE FACILITY. SUPPORT SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO SENIORS INCLUDING BENEFITS CHECK-UPS, HEALTH AND WELLNESS ACTIVITIES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING, TRIPS, SOCIAL EVENTS, INTEGRATIONAL ACTIVITIES, AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIORS TO HELP EACH OTHER AND THE COMMUNITY (NEIGHBOR HELPING NEIGHBOR). THE GOALS ARE TO ENABLE SENIORS TO MAINTAIN THE GREATEST LEVEL OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY POSSIBLE AND ENGAGE IN MEANINGFUL ACTIVITIES IN THE COMMUNITY. THE STADIUM PLACE CAMPUS ALSO IS HOME TO A COMMUNITY-BUILT PLAYGROUND, THE HARRY AND JEANETTE WEINBERG YMCA AT STADIUM PLACE, THE THANKSGIVING PLACE ENTRY PLAZE (A MEDITATIVE GARDEN AND LABYRINTH), AND THE RIPKEN YOUTH DEVELPOMENT BALLFIELD. THE NEIGHBOR HELPING NEIGHBOR PROGRAM IS A TIME BANK MODEL OF SERVICE EXCHANGE, WHERE MEMEBERS PROVIDE A WIDE SPECTRUM OF SUPPORT SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES FOR OTHER MEMBERS. THE GOAL IS TO INCREASE PARTICIPANTS' QUALITY OF LIFE AND SENSE OF INDEPENDANCE BY MOBILIZING SOCIAL CAPTIAL (THE COLLECTIVE VALUE OF SOCIAL CONNECTIONS AND NETWORKS) AND PARTICIPANTS' SKILLS AND TALENTS. THE PROGRAM SUPPORTS THE PARTICIPANTS IN LIVING INDEPENDANTLY, AS WELL AS CONTINUING TO LEAD MEANINGFUL AND ENGAGED LIVES. MEMBERS ARE AVAILABLE TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO EACH OTHER, INCLUDING COMPANIONSHIP, DOMESTIC SERVICES, AND TRANSPORTATION. THE PROGRAM HAS MORE THAN 100 MEMEBERS WHO LIVE AT STATDIUM PLACE, AS WELL AS SEVERAL GROUPS WHO VOLUNTEER REGULARYLY AT STADIUM PLACE. OVERALL, MEMEBERS EARNED OVER 500 HOURS DURING THE PAST YEAR THROUGH VARIOUS ONE ON ONE AND COMMUNITY WIDE ACTIVITIES. A LARGE NUMBER OF MEMEBERS HAVE ASSISTED IN THE DISTRIBUTION OF FRESH PRODUCE RECEIVED FROM THE MARYLAND FOOD BANK. MEMEBERS OF NEIGHBOR HELPING NEIGHBOR ALSO GATHERED FOR SOCIAL EVENTS AND A GARDENING CLUB.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF THE ASC, ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAXES. THIS TOPIC REQUIRES THE ORGANIZATION TO RECOGNIZE OR DISCLOSE ANY TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD RESULT IN UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS NO POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE DISCLOSURE OR RECOGNITION UNDER THE TOPIC. GEDCO AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES' TAX RETURNS FOR FISCAL YEARS DECEMBER 31, 2014 AND AFTER ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATIONS BY THE IRS AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES.

EXPANDED MISSION STATEMENT GEDCO, ALONG WITH ITS KEY PARTNERS, IS DEVELOPING A MIXED INCOME RETIREMENT COMMUNITY AT STADIUM PLACE, SITE OF THE FORMER MEMORIAL STADIUM IN NORTHERN BALTIMORE CITY. THE CAMPUS CURRENTLY INCLUDES FOUR APARTMENT BUIDLINGS FOR OVER 350 OLDER ADULTS, FULL SERVICE YMCA WITH COMMUNITY CENTER AND RECREATION FACILITIES, THANKSGIVING PLACE (A MEDITATIVE GARDEN WITH A LABYRINTH), A COMMUNITY BUILT PLAYGROUND, AND THE GREEN HOUSE RESIDENCES (R), A NEW MODEL OF MEDICAL LONG TERM CARE. ADDITIONAL PROJECTS CURRENTLY IN PLANNING INCLUDE VILLAGE CENTER, WITH RETAIL, COMMERCIAL, OFFICE, AND COMMUNITY GATHERING SPACE, AND 72 MARKET RATE RENTAL APARTMENTS. STADIUM PLACE IS A NATIONAL MODEL OF PROVIDING HOUSING AND COMPREHENSIVE SERVICES FOR URBAN SENIORS IN A CAMPUS THAT ALSO SERVES THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOODS. THE MISSION OF STADIUM PLACE IS TO MAXIMIZE THE PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND SPIRITUAL POTENTIAL OF INDIVIDUALS THROUGH A HOLISTIC CONTINUUM OF SUPPORT SERVICES AND SENIOR HOUSING. THE GUIDING PRINCIPLES OF STADIUM PLACE ARE THAT IT BE:(1) HOUSING WITH SERVICES; (2) LINKED WITH THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY; (3) INTERGENERATIONAL; AND (4) DIVERSE IN EVERY WAY,INCLUDING AGE, RACE AND INCOME LEVELS. RESIDENTS CONTINUE TO LIVE MEANINGFUL AND ENGAGED LIVES WITH NUMEROUS OPPORTUNITIES FOR INVOLVEMENT AT STADIUM PLACE AND IN THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY. THE GEDCO VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR AND SENIOR SERVICES TEAM MAINTAIN PARTNERSHIPS WITH NUMEROUS GOVERNMENT AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE LINKS TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOODS AND VARIOUS VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES. THERE ARE FOUR ACTIVE RESIDENT COUNCILS, AND THE RESIDENTS ARE ALSO HELPING EACH OTHER THROUGH THE NEIGHBOR HELPING NEIGHBOR PROGRAM. THE NEIGHBOR HELPING NEIGHBOR PROGRAM IS A TIME BANK MODEL OF SERVICE EXCHANGE, WHERE MEMBERS PROVIDE A WIDE SPECTRUM OF SUPPORT SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES FOR OTHER MEMBERS. THE PROGRAM SUPPORTS THE PARTICIPANTS IN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, AS WELL AS CONTINUING TO LEAD MEANINGFUL ENGAGED LIVES. GEDCO HAS DEVELOPED A SERIES OF COMMUNITY BASED SERVICES AT STADIUM PLACE. RESIDENTS PARTICIPATE IN THE EATING TOGETHER PROGRAM, A DAILY LUNCH PROGRAM AT THE EDNOR APARTMENTS I WHICH IS COORDINATED BY THE BALTIMORE CITY COMMISSION ON AGING AND RETIREMENT EDUCATION (CARE). CARE ALSO PROVIDES HOME HEALTH AIDES AS PART OF THE SENIOR CARE PROGRAM. A WEEKLY SHOPPING SHUTTLE AND MONTHLY TRIPS ARE PROVIDED THROUGH ACTION IN MATURITY. RESIDENTS ALSO PARTICIPATE IN WEEKLY LINE DANCING PROVIDED BY THE BALTIMORE CITY DEPARTMENT OF RECREATION AND PARKS AND EXERCISE PROGRAMS AT THE STADIUM PLACE Y (WHERE DISCOUNTED MEMBERSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE). RESIDENTS COORDINATE VARIOUS PROGRAMS AND EVENTS THROUGH THEIR OWN RESIDENT COUNCILS, INCLUDING BIRTHDAY AND HOLIDAY PARTIES, TRIPS, GAME NIGHTS, BINGO, CRAFT CLUB, ETC. IN ADDITION, THE GEDCO SERVICE COORDINATORS DEVELOP EDUCATIONAL AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS WITH LOCAL HOSPITALS, UNIVERSITIES, AND OTHER EXPERTS IN THE AGING COMMUNITY, INCLUDING: THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND SCHOOL OF PHARMACY; JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF NURSING; ERIKSON SCHOOL OF MANAGEMENT, AGING AND POLICY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, BALTIMORE COUNTY; AND ST. JOSEPH'S MEDICAL CENTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITEE REVIEWS AND APPROVES BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS SIGN CONFLICT OF INTERETS LETTERS ANNUALLY. EMPLOYEES HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST CLAUSE IN THE EMPLOYEE CONTRACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITEE PREPARES AN EVALUATION AND RECOMMENDATION, THEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS EVALUATES AND APPROVES THE DECISION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE VIA GUIDESTAR AND BY REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INTERESTED PARTIES CAN CALL OR EMAIL THE ORGANIZATION TO REQUEST A COPY.
AMENDED RETURN EXPLANATION: THE RETURN IS BEING AMENDED TO REFLECT CHANGES PER THE AUDITED FINANCIALS WHICH WERE ISSUED SUBSEQUENT TO FILING THE ORIGINAL FORM 990.
